There’s Kashmiri fare to gorge on, crackling fireplaces to cosy up by and the winter sun to enjoy from the comfort of your room. Plan a stay at one of these idyllic homestays, houseboats, and hotels in Srinagar and explore the history, culture and scenic sights of the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir.Jump to:Homestays in SrinagarHouseboats in SrinagarHotels in SrinagarQayaam Gah, BreinThe Qayaam experience is all about slowing down and spending days sipping on qahwa, watching shikaras drift by and trailing through local villages for a taste of Kashmiri culture. Book any of the four villas and enjoy the mountain views from the adjoining verandahs. The property is framed by the rugged Zabarwan hills and sits right above Dal Lake, offering guests a range of wellness experiences that range from seven to 10 days in duration. An inhouse instructor teaches yoga and relaxation techniques and accompanies guests on hikes throughout the day. A local troupe playing live music takes over the deck, Qalb, at high tea, and there’s also a canopied pavilion for private dinners. Ruh, the in-house restaurant and library, is where you can perch yourself with a book and a soothing cup of saffron tea while taking in the breathtaking views and crisp winter sun. Doubles from Rs30,000Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowSEBASTIAN ZACHARIAH'09Vivanta Dal View, Srinagar, BreinIts location on Kralsangri Hill affords this stylish hotel in Srinagar one of the best views in the Valley. Spread over six acres, the property has 84 rooms spread across two-room villas, and a common infinity pool which remains open through the summers. Ask their concierge to book you a speciality experience like a multi-course Kashmiri wazwan feast or a visit to a papier-mâché factory. The property is undergoing renovation until March 2024, and guests are advised to contact the team before making reservations. Doubles from Rs34,000Pet friendly: YesWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowThe LaLiT Grand Palace Srinagar, Gupkar RoadThis historic Srinagar hotel was a royal abode built in 1910 and its landmark chinar tree is where Mahatma Gandhi met with Maharaja Hari Singh during India’s partition. The hotel boasts 113 well-appointed rooms including suites and cottages. Guests can relax after a day’s sightseeing with a book on the sprawling lawns, at the temperature-controlled indoor pool or at their in-house wellness retreat—Rejuve – The Spa. Enjoy the spices and flavours of Kashmir at The Chinar, which spills into the lawn for alfresco dining during the summers. For added convenience, the team can arrange private air charter service and butlers on call. Doubles from Rs25,000Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowRah Bagh by the Orchard, HarwanRah Bagh is a 36-key property, with each room offering stunning views of the Dal and Nigeen lakes from its huge windows and private sit-outs. Nature meets creature comforts here–a hot tub sits pretty next to a temperature-controlled pool and the Dachigam National Park is just 10 minutes away for a quick adventure. For those looking to venture beyond Srinagar, the team is happy to curate and execute trips to destinations such as Sonamarg, Pahalgam, and Gurez. Doubles from Rs17,500Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowNadis Hotel, HarwanSituated in a sparsely populated residential area, Nadis is a compact, 18-room property in a breathtakingly beautiful setting in the foothills of the Zabarwan hills. Owner Yaser Shaw has built the hotel in a way that every room is kitted out with carved ceilings, elegant decor and picture-postcard views of the mountains. Sip on qahwa in the lawns here, savour Kashmiri cuisine prepared from locally sourced ingredients, or spend a morning ambling through the orchards on the premises. A local guide from the team will take you around the city as well as through the nearby Dachigam Wildlife Sanctuary, should you be in the mood for some hyperlocal exploration. Doubles from Rs9,300Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowKaran Mahal, Sonwar BaghIn 1936, the beautiful Karan Mahal became the official residence of Dr Karan Singh, the then crown prince of Jammu and Kashmir, and has since, been owned by the members of the royal family. The seven-key property sits between two hills of the Zabarwan mountain range. Nearly 60 acres of orchards and woods surround it and there are plenty of animal sightings on everyday walks. The antique furniture, hand-knotted wool carpets and grand chandeliers exude regality, while the set menu with home-cooked food–including Himalayan trout and gucchi pulao–reflects the family’s history. Doubles from Rs25,000Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowFour Points by Sheraton Srinagar, Sonwar BaghAbout 2km from Lal Chowk, this hotel is situated in downtown Srinagar a short ride away from Dal lake. With a kids playroom and a 24-hour fitness centre, it’s the perfect place for a family getaway as well as a quiet workation. The rooms come with stunning views of the skyline, and the hotel stands close to major sightseeing spots including the floating market on Dal Lake. From pasta to local fare, there is a range of offerings at The Eatery, the hotel’s multicuisine all-day diner. Doubles from Rs11,700Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowAthul PrasadFortune Resort Heevan, NishatExpect spectacular views of the Zabarwan hills from this 39-key property. While certain elements–such as wooden flooring and private balconies–are common across different categories, the rooms vary in size. For food, there are three dining venues and a tea lounge in the lobby, which means you can enjoy everything from North Indian fare to a range of qahwas, each at a different location. Doubles from Rs15,200Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook NowDar Es Salam, Nigeen LakeBuilt in the 1940s by Maqsud Ali as his personal home, this idyllic property is now run by his son Musadiq as a boutique hotel by the banks of Nigeen Lake. Every detail—from the fine wooden furniture to the blossoms that grow in its garden—were handpicked by the senior Ali to build his dream house. Though laid out in a homely setting, Dar Es Salam offers all the comforts of a hotel–there is a dining room named Khasa, serving an exhaustive menu with Indian, Chinese and European cuisines, as well as room service. The house is centrally heated, and there are facilities like WiFi and printing services available. Outside, where Nigeen Lake meets Dal Lake, guests can enjoy quiet birdwatching sessions with mallards, egrets and several other winged visitors flying over the lawns. Doubles from Rs10,500Pet friendly: NoWheelchair accessible: YesBook Now*Prices are subject to change. All products are independently selected by our editors.
